term.name: Weight Discrepancy
term.description: Weight discrepancy refers to the difference between the declared (entered) weight of a shipment and its actual measured weight recorded by the courier partner.

dead_weight.description: The actual physical weight of the package measured in kilograms (kg).

volumetric_weight.description: The calculated weight of a package based on its dimensions, using the formula: (Length × Breadth × Height) ÷ 5000.

notes: Courier partners charge based on whichever is higher: dead weight or volumetric weight.
If there is a mismatch between declared and actual weight, a weight discrepancy charge may be applied.
Always enter accurate package dimensions and weight during order creation to avoid penalties.
